website_summaries.verdict: A folding scooter perfect for taking with you on trips and errands. Steering and wheel design seem to make it better for indoor use.
pros: Well designed for indoor and limited outdoor use
Easily adjustable knee platform and handle height
Scooter folds at the handlebars to increase portability
Grips are padded for comfortable use
cons: Some noticed the padding seemed to wear unevenly
May not perform well on rough or uneven surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: I fractured my ankle Memorial Day Weekend. I started out on crutches and than purchased this scooter per my Orthopedic Surgeon's recommendation. All I have to say is this is a lifesaver. I have been able to go to work, go to the super market, and get around much easier than crutches. If you like attention, this scooter will definitely turn you into a superstar wherever you go. Everyone wants to ride it. People see your boot and scratch their temples like how is she getting around post surgery so easily. I LOVE IT! Also fits easily in my trunk and I have a Honda Accord Coupe. If you have any leg or foot injury this is a MUST HAVE!
customer_reviews.author: VAL

customer_reviews.title: They are great knee scooters.!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got two of them because i have a two level home i have one in the upper part and one in the lower part and use one to go out and about when we go away.!!!!! Most places wanted over a $100.00 a month so what i paid for two of them would have been more then what i paid for two of them.!!!!!! They are the best and weight capacity is 350 pounds per each one and they come in three colors as well.!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Adequete indoors, outside use beware!
customer_reviews.text: I feel qualified to write a review after riding this knee scooter across several airports and visiting museums and memorials in Washington DC. The scooter performed adequately on indoor smooth surfaces but was not good on the roughened concrete used in many sidewalks. It was totally useless on gravel or brick walkways. If you need to go on a variety of surfaces, find a scooter with larger, wider tires. The scooter was not as stable as other ones I have used but by positioning my weigh towards the back wheels, I avoided problems. The seat where you rest your knee is very comfortable. The design of the knee-rest is the best part of this light-weight scooter.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Roscoe Knee Scooter Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time we’ve used this exact knee scooter following my child’s foot surgery. It handles smoothly, is easy to transport, and he feels confident on it (very little risk of falling). The basket is incredibly helpful so that he can carry his water and other items to keep his hands on the handle bars. We highly recommend this knee scooter!
customer_reviews.author: ForgetMeNot

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid scooter that works well.
customer_reviews.text: The scooter is easy to assemble and it maneuvers well in tight spaces. The wheels are quiet and non-marring to your floor. A simple design allows one to collapse the steer bar with ease to get in and out of the car, even though many cars will accept the scooter without having to collapse the bar. This is the same scooter that I was renting for $100 / month at the local Medical supply. So consider it commercial for use.
customer_reviews.author: fiddlewaltzer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Well built, sturdy and easy to assemble and adjust. I've been using it for 3.5 weeks now and can't find anything I don't like about it. I use the handy basket to carry things for me and I also bought a sheep skin cover for it, which I like. FYI: I didn't catch this right away, but the seat goes on a certain way depending on the side of the injury. Not sure if it makes too much of a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Annja64

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and fairly lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This scooter was super easy to assemble and fairly lightweight when you need to lift it over thresholds. I wished the brake cable didn’t stick out so far because I catch my kitchen knobs with it all the time. I tried to move the cable more toward the center post but it affects the breaking mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Brown

customer_reviews.title: Found Damaged upon Deliver
customer_reviews.text: This scooter arrived in a box with three holes in the box. When opened, I found the post where you attached the seat, damaged beyond anything I could do to repair it. It evidently took a severe blow. The damage was probably done in transit. The scooter, itself, seemed to be well made. I do not think this damage was the cause of the manufacturer. I had to return the scooter.
customer_reviews.author: EMS

customer_reviews.title: however much better than trying to maneuver around my house all the ...
customer_reviews.text: Second foot surgery and for this one I decided on a scooter. The reviews for this are accurate the turn ratio is a little large, however much better than trying to maneuver around my house all the time on crutches. I spent nine weeks with crutches and this scooter was great. I did go flying twice when I went to the park to coach soccer and took the scooter. Should have got all terrain wheels because the slightest rock and trouble isn't far behind. However, for inside this was perfect
customer_reviews.author: The Brit

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness for Roscoe!  A real lifesaver!,
customer_reviews.text: WhenI purchase this several months ago I was a little skeptical about what the quality would be. We received it and my fears were put to rest. Made extremely well and sturdy. My husband had crushed his his heel and using crutches and a walker were very cumbersome. He had no problem using and was very adept at it. Could move faster than I could. We searched for one in our area and found one place about 30 miles away. They wanted $25 a week, plus we would have had to pay shipping to and from our residence. Thanks Roscoe
customer_reviews.author: Renw

customer_reviews.title: Poor steering and parking brake.
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot better than crutches or a wheelchair, however, it's terrible at making turns. Turning tight corners in a hallway are impossible without reversing, turning the handlebars, going forward, turning the handlebars and repeating this step multiple times. You can also just get off the scooter and pick it up and reposition it and move on. The brakes are good when you need to stop, but the parking brake is weak when you need to stay in one place. The assembly instructions were difficult to follow, so I recommend viewing the video that the company has on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: Lyd

customer_reviews.title: Roscoe is one of my best friends. Easy to put together and it was ...
customer_reviews.text: Roscoe was a God send. Had foot surgery and could not put any weight on my foot. If I had to use crutches the whole time, I would have been dead. Yes, Roscoe is one of my best friends. Easy to put together and it was fairly easy to transport in our car. Rolls very easy on hard surfaces. You have to exert some energy on rugged areas. Recommend it highly. Medicare does not cover the cost of buying Roscoe. It was cheaper to buy Roscoe than to rent it from the local medical supply store for the length of time I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Day

customer_reviews.title: Good Knee Scooter.
customer_reviews.text: This scooter was originally intended just for myself. Then a coworker of mine injured her foot and I let her use at work since she is the one who is running around. It's very easy to adjust and fits into the trunk of my Honda. I am a big guy so it can hold my weight very well. It handles as expected rolling through rough parking lots. It does extremely well at my second job where I work at a big box store and having to run from one end of the store to the other constantly. The scooters brakes work very well and they do not grab. The basket is indispensable.
customer_reviews.author: Norm

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy knee scooter
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy knee scooter and served me well for almost 3 months. I agree with one reviewer who said to purchase it ahead of your surgery and use it to get used to it. It does NOT make short turns and I joked that instead of a 3 point turn it makes 12 point turns, but it saved me from using crutches or a wheelchair for the 8 weeks I could not put any weight on my foot after major surgery. The basket was also handy to carry items from one room to another. I purchased the knee pad cover which also helped cushion my knee.
customer_reviews.author: MJO

customer_reviews.title: Good Scooter - But
customer_reviews.text: The scooter was well built and easy to assemble. Unfortunately I had to return it. My home has terrazzo tile floors and the grout lines are slightly lower than the tile itself. Given the rather firm tires on the Roscoe scooter, rolling across the tile floor caused the steering handle to jerk right and left to the point of almost losing control if going very fast. This scooter would be fine on a smooth surface. I exchanged this scooter for one with pneumatic tires which solved the "jerking" problem and provides a more comfortable ride. The exchange through Amazon was flawless.
customer_reviews.author: wtom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This scooter is well made, sturdy, and easy to handle & turn. Perfect for indoors or sidewalk. Very little assembly. I put it together and I'm a grandmother of 68. Basically, it's hinged in two places the seat support and the handle support. Raise both of those and tighten screw down with hand. Then there a clip to snap tighter. Really easy. I first bought an all-terrain scooter, but it was not good for inside the house.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth T.

customer_reviews.title: Great device!
customer_reviews.text: Due to a broken foot and non-weight bearing status, I decided to purchase my own scooter instead of waiting for the insurance company to approve one. What a great purchase! So easy to assemble! And I’m more mobile than in the previous couple of weeks. It is the perfect device to use at home. Very sturdy. I have not gone outside with it yet though, so I can’t comment on that. We have a small townhouse but with a little ingenuity, it works like a charm. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Christy

customer_reviews.title: Adequately satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The slightly decreased wheel width of front wheels allowed for easier storage in the trunk of my sports car when compared to two previous knee caddies we've used in the past. The break system is solid and feels safe even if it is wet outside. I had hoped the cushion was full one piece vice how they are seperate. The ability to adjust for which foor is hurt is also a great feature. My particular caddee's handle bar I received was slightly crooked, not aligned with the front wheels. Other than that, I could tell the parts were of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Hieu

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and sturdy. So much better than crutches, you cannot believe it. On the 'bad' side, this is best used on a smooth surface - I have used it on the road, but small pebbles can cause the scooter to turn - you have to be careful. Also, I've driven over my 'good' foot, causing me to almost tip over. Still easier and I believe safer than crutches.
customer_reviews.author: Alan R. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on my doorstep in 2 days! It was mostly assembled and the final assembly was pretty easy, no tools required. This scooter has made my life so much easier since I broke my foot. Basket is helpful when shopping for a few small items, but doesn't hold too much. Loading and unloading in the car is tricky when I'm alone but I can do it. However, I am young and pretty fit, so it may prove to bee more difficult for someone weaker or elderly. I was also very happy with the price. A similar scooter was $650 at their medical mobility store. I love my knee scooter, I don't know what I would have done without it.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: made life easier
customer_reviews.text: Torn ligament, off my feet for 5-6 weeks. crutches are painful and dangerous. now I can move freely pretty much throughout the house. Thank goodness my hands are free! assembly was easy and it works great. I won't use it on my pecan stain laminate floors, leaves a coating that's hard to wash away. Great on tile and light colored laminate. Doesn't completely eliminate crutches but does 80% of the time. Several moves to turn corners, but that doesn't pose a problem. Light weight, easy to lift. Cushion for the injured leg is very, very hard. You'll need sheepskin or a towel or something. I'm using a soft cashmere scarf that does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: S.S.X.

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead, hit purchase
customer_reviews.text: This scooter is more stable than the ones I rented. The back wheels are closer together, which keeps them out of the way when you paddle. My rental scooters gave me bruises on the back of my leg. If you're going to be on the scooter for more than a couple of months, you may as well buy one, it's cheaper in the long run. The only thing I would ask for would be a "winterizing package." It would be helpful if the scooter had a reflector, or two, so it would be more visible at night.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Williams

customer_reviews.title: BEST scooter for the money AND comfort!
customer_reviews.text: This scooter is by far so much nicer than the one I rented in October 2015 when I had foot surgery. I bought this one because I will need to have surgery on my left foot in the future. The brake is great! The wheels are quiet and it glides so smooth! Was easy to assemble. Love the basket! And the best thing is the comfortable seat! My advice...Don't rent from places..BUY THIS instead if you need more than one surgery! It's worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: ... way to use this thing but it's wheels would easily get caught on bumps in the sidewalk
customer_reviews.text: I tried every way to use this thing but it's wheels would easily get caught on bumps in the sidewalk. I received two the first one was defective as the steering was way off. I tried and tried to use but it caused new knee pain and stopped at little bumps in the road or sidewalks.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Spatafore

customer_reviews.title: A must have for foot surgery!
customer_reviews.text: This scooter has been a life saver! I can get around my house easily. Well worth the money if you are having surgery which requires you to stay off your foot. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars was the lack of good directions for putting this together. It was somewhat straight forward luckily, but mostly a picture so you had to do a little guessing, and without directions I was unable to figure out how to work the spring in front that allows this to fold up for transportation.
customer_reviews.author: Leah R

customer_reviews.title: Knee pad extremely uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I found the knee attachment to be extremely uncomfortable to the point that I have been unable to use this product. There have been many complaints about this on a website where people have ordered a cover for the knee pads and have had to fill the cover either with foam or some other type of material. I am sure the manufacturer is aware of this, and hopefully they will resolve this problem. Also the steering column does need to be adjusted to make a decent turn. . .
customer_reviews.author: Deep Blue

customer_reviews.title: Good scooter if you don't have far to go.
customer_reviews.text: Good scooter if you don't have far to go. Got it after surgery for a ruptured achilles. Very unstable cruising down a sidewalk. Going from doctor's office to car today I was more concerned about flipping it and suffering a head injury than re-injuring my achilles. Hair-trigger brakes make it stop suddenly. Found it easier to just drag my good leg on the sidewalk to slow down. Gave it 3 stars because other models are probably just as bad. This was advertised as "professional grade". Not so sure if that's true. Hopefully, I'll only need it for another month.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful for my disabled mother
customer_reviews.text: My Mother requires a Knee Scooter due to a permanent medical condition with her right foot. She's used this scooter for over two years now, and it is holding up great. I do suggest buying the pad also made by Roscoe Medical. It is much easier to clean that way and soft on the knee. It only takes a little bit of effort to remove the basket and fold down the handlebars if you need to travel with the scooter.
customer_reviews.author: Lindy Norris

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: This was so critical to bringing some level of autonomy and normalcy to months of my life after foot surgeries. This thing not only physically supported me, but also helped me retain my sanity.
customer_reviews.author: Seoh

customer_reviews.title: Overall good scooter
customer_reviews.text: So first of all, I must say that I am not complaining because this is so much better than crutches. Overall a nice scooter; however, I do wish I would have gotten a Drive Medical DV8 because this scooter doesn't fold and it's hard to put it in the car. The only reason I got this one was because it was cheaper than DV8 and that it had a basket. Pros: - Easy to assemble - Has a basket - Choice of colors Cons: - Doesn't fold - Kind of heavy to lift by yourself - Turning radius is pretty bad
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Assembly was easy, even without instructions
customer_reviews.text: It's getting 4 instead of 5 stars because it lacked any paperwork except for a very small warranty card. Assembly was easy, even without instructions, which as it turns out, are available on the web. The scooter is stable, rolls easily on wood or tile floors, and is only a little slower on carpet. Cost from Amazon was just a little more than renting one for one month, so I purchased it since I'll need it for two months, and then again when I get my other foot done. The knee pad is molded for both left and right knees - just swivel the pad 180° so that whichever you need is closest to the handlebars.
customer_reviews.author: JayTee

customer_reviews.title: For the price a good scooter
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a big fan of the split knee bench but I get the reason for it. If I had a boot on I could see it being useful. I thought the price was outstanding and found the scooter great for getting around in a city.
customer_reviews.author: rno

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Don't think twice, just BUY THIS. After a Brostrom-Gould ankle surgery (stabilization of the ankle with anchors) I found myself unable to use crutches and the standard walker was exhausting. This scooter allowed me to travel safely & quickly around the house, and even shopping at the mall! A sanity saver for 5 weeks of non-weight bearing. Thank you so much Roscoe Medical for manufacturing this.
customer_reviews.author: ANW

customer_reviews.title: This is a super nice knee scooter and very well made
customer_reviews.text: This is a super nice knee scooter and very well made. I purchased this for my mom for her upcoming ankle replacement surgery and you cannot beat the price of this scooter compared to medical places that I contacted. Color is gorgeous - a pretty burgundy and the scooter is a havy metal, not cheaply made either. Knee pad is cozy, I also purchased a cover for the knee pad that fit it perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Ness

customer_reviews.title: No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. Very sturdy. Brake works well for slowing down and parking. Easy to collapse to put in the trunk and then easy to set back up. Padded cover is a must unless patient doesn't use it much. Buy it separately. Basket is also a must. Without it there is no way for the patient to take anything with them unless they find a bag or satchel adequate (think coffee, papers, urinal).
customer_reviews.author: Babz

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Scooter
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful while recovering from foot surgery. I definitely recommend using a scooter and this Roscoe one worked well for me. Felt sturdy and rolled smoothly. I looked into renting one but for the length of time I needed it, it was less expensive to buy one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I was very worried about buying this because I had not used one before and they are not cheap. I was very surprised at how well this is made, it even looks strong. I was so happy to realize that after about 10 seconds, I was using this like a pro. I had no trouble getting around with it. It was so nice not to have to depend on some one to help me to the restroom. I only needed it for a couple of weeks but I'm so glad to know if I need it again, it's already here. It really did make a world of difference for me. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Linville

customer_reviews.title: Great scooter
customer_reviews.text: I got the knee scooter after I had Achilles Tender surgery and had to be off my foot for six weeks. It sure worked a lot better than using crutches. I was able to scoot around the house, and even get out to go to lunch or dinner when someone took me for an outing. I have loaned it out twice now to friends that needed help getting around after a surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Legacygold

customer_reviews.title: Well built overall, but cushion already splitting at the seams
customer_reviews.text: This scooter is very solidly built and is easily adjusted. I've had just one problem; the cusion has already started to split at the seams after my wife has used it for just 6 weeks. And she is less than half the weight of the stated weight capacity. I've contacted the manufacturer to see what they will do. Wife loves the maneuverability compared to crutches and wheelchairs; both of which she's used before for previous foot surgeries. As others have noted, not a very tight turning radius, but that probably helps stability.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: I had surgery on my left foot and scooter has made it very easy for me to get around inside of my home ...
customer_reviews.text: This has been a true life saver for me. I had surgery on my left foot and scooter has made it very easy for me to get around inside of my home and out side of my home. The handle bars fold easily and light weight for transporting in the car. The basket is an added bonus for me to carry my work at the office along with any thing that you need to take with you. .
customer_reviews.author: Doreen B.

customer_reviews.title: Not stable enough
customer_reviews.text: Too difficult to maneuver over carpets and outside with the small wheels, would not work outside. Had to get one with large wheels for stability.
customer_reviews.author: Laure

customer_reviews.title: With practice,  a true blessing.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, useful, good value...invaluable after major foot surgery. Basket was a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Taylor

customer_reviews.title: excellent after foot surgery
customer_reviews.text: excellent after foot surgery. Only way to get around and live an almost normal life. Assembly instructions were not in a logical sequence. It would have been easier and quicker to assemble if I hadn't read them at all and just used the labelled pictures of the parts. Instructions also did not take into consideration out to disassemble for the way it was packed to fit in the box.
customer_reviews.author: BGHD

customer_reviews.title: So useful with a broken ankle to be able to get ...
customer_reviews.text: So useful with a broken ankle to be able to get around. It can be dangerous to use when on uneven pavement, asphalt parking lots, and cracks in the sidewalk. It is perfect for indoor use. When grocery shopping last Sunday I ran into a small pebble coming back to my vehicle. The scooter began to tip I had to brace myself onto the side of our truck or I would have fallen. Like I said this is a great scooter just keep it to indoor use.
customer_reviews.author: Therapist

customer_reviews.title: It is perfect for someone who needs to be non weight bearing ...
customer_reviews.text: The knee scooter was everything I expected. It gave a freedom needed that crutches nor walker could. The only drawback was the turning ratio. in tight places, You need to either go back and forth to get turned around or lift the vehicle off the ground. You also need a fair amount of upper body strength to use the scooter for any length of time. It is perfect for someone who needs to be non weight bearing for a long period of time. It is also useful when you are standing in the kitchen as it gives you the freedom with your hands. I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Scooting.
customer_reviews.text: The big wheels allow this knee scooter to move easily over rough surfaces. Seat.knee height adjustment is easy to use. Unit folds and fits easily into the trunk of my BMW Z car.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Foreman

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: This is my second knee scooter of this type. The first lasted slightly more than 2 years. Became unsafe in that wheels were wobbly and unsafe, and the handlebars were not secure. No brakes. If need long term, figure about a year and a half to 2 years life for this unit. That being said, this scooter is very helpful getting around. I have been able to use it to continue working and have taken several trips including to San Francisco and was able to get around very well. Roscoes customer service is polite but not at all helpful if anything goes wrong. Overall a very good product Only wish it lasted a bit longer with constant use.
customer_reviews.author: jpmk

customer_reviews.title: This knee scooter was awesome. I could go any where except stairs
customer_reviews.text: I broke my ankle and didn't want to hassle with crutches. This knee scooter was awesome. I could go any where except stairs. It was easy to get on and off without putting weight on my ankle. I even used it in the restroom and transferring from it to a shower chair. If you have a foot or ankle that the doctor does not want you to put weight on, then get this knee scooter.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Scooter - Does not roll well on uneven surfaces
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent scooter for folks needing mobility with a zero weight bearing foot injury. The only negative is the small wheels. It does not travel very well over door thresholds, gravel or uneven brick sidewalks. There are similar (more expensive) scooter will larger all terrain type tires that I wished we had purchased.
customer_reviews.author: John Otterson

customer_reviews.title: Well done
customer_reviews.text: This scooter is very well made. I am not sure about some of the negative review's about quality, I can't explain those, but I was somewhat expecting mediocre quality and was very pleased when I put this scooter together. This scooter was a great buy. If we would have rented this we would nearly have paid the purchase price. The resale price on the used ones is also very high so I imagine we will be able to sell this with no problem if we decide too. My wife liked the basket and the smooth ride.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: It came on time. It is exactly what the ...
customer_reviews.text: It came on time. It is exactly what the seller say. But be sure to buy together the cover pad because it hurts your knee after just a few minutes of using it without a cover.
customer_reviews.author: Montserrat Bellini

customer_reviews.title: Much better than crutches.
customer_reviews.text: I've rupture my left Achilles and used crutches and a wheel chair the first time around. Before surgery for my other achilles I ordered this knee walker and loved it. The basket provided my with a level of independence I wouldn't have with crutches as I could carry things and even cook some meals. The only thing you have to be careful with is the small wheels as if you hit a crack in the concrete without a good grip on the handles or other foot down you can fall. Other thing of note is the brake is a drum style brake which will restrict forward motion but it can go backwards at will.
customer_reviews.author: P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice knee scooter. Gout flared up in right foot and the scooter made it possible to get to the restroom and the doctor. very stable, a little harder to push on deep carpet, but still does work ok. basket is a nice touch. not a super turn radius, but very easy to back and fill and get turned. Does fold smaller, but hardly needed since it easily fits in a car. Very sturdy. Good purchase
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: NIcely priced, comes fast with Amazon prime and helped me when I needed it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I broke my foot. You have to be a little careful if you use it on uneven concrete surfaces and if there is debris on the road. I crashed with this twice but did not hurt myself. If you are a fragile person and are prone to falling then you will need to be VERY careful when using this. I gave it to my orthopedist to loan to other patients. I don't plan to break my foot again and did not want to store it. He was happy to get it.
customer_reviews.author: Wood worker and techy guy

customer_reviews.title: Everyone Should Have One
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to operate. Was a huge help while I was non-weight bearing. Far superior to a walker. Very reasonable price, considering that it would have cost more to rent for the period in which I used it than to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Capecoder

customer_reviews.title: I wish my doctor told me about this right off the bat!
customer_reviews.text: My brother has a history of foot injuries and insisted I use this about half way through my recovery from a badly broken foot. This product made my recovery from a broken foot SO MUCH EASIER. And got me the nickname "Scooter" in my office for a couple of months. Just a heads up- the button you have to press to unlock and fold the handle bar is a bit tough, I repeatedly broke my nails trying to push it. Also be careful on uneven surfaces, the wheels aren't heavy duty and you can build up some speed so hitting a bump or hole can be dangerous. The brake is so necessary and the basket is a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley M Rossetti

customer_reviews.title: Life saver at any cost.
customer_reviews.text: For those with a lower leg injury or recovering from surgery this is the best way to maintain some semblance of quality of life. It allows one to easily move about the confines of home and greater distances away from home and outdoors. This scooter is well made and looks good. The maroon paint of my scooter looks great also. If you have a lower leg injury or expect to have surgery on the foot/lower leg get one of these before going to the operating room. Superb quality design at an excellent price. Crutches are like an instrument of torture.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Rice

customer_reviews.title: Don't get crazy with it, be safe
customer_reviews.text: This thing saved me from being an invalid till my foot surgery healed. You are able to get around to do things you couldn't otherwise do, under the circumstances. I have lent mine to a friend now who is very happily using it
customer_reviews.author: J. Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Drum brakes are awesome.
customer_reviews.text: The scooter has been my main form of movement for almost two months and I have m to go. I'm sorry to have had to use it but so thankful it works so well. The drum brakes are wonderful. My husband says it is an engineering marvel, the design is great and the points of welding are quality. I only gave it four stars because one of the major parts is the knee pad. It is so hard I was constantly trying to find softer padding. My knee is constantly hurting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Life Saver after Ankle Surgery!
customer_reviews.text: My husband ankle replacement surgery and the surgeon recommended a scooter to optimize his mobility during the Non-weight bearing stage of recovery. After trying to buy used ones and exploring rentals, this knee scooter seemed to be the best of the best. So after reading all the reviews we bought it. It has been a life saver. Easy to put together, easy to transport--and comfortable to "scoot around" the house, grocery store, and mall. We are going to keep it in case someone else in our family or one of our friends need to borrow it.
customer_reviews.author: PCQuinn

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED my scooter. I lived on this thing for two long months, and even had to use it again when my foot surgery flared up. Great quality. Very sturdy. Definitely worth the money to purchase. The basket was a lifesaver too. Be careful when turning though. I dumped myself on my first day back from work. Was at a funky angle and turned around to wave at someone, and over I went. That was my problem though, not the product. I highly recommend this procuct!
customer_reviews.author: Princess

customer_reviews.title: I love this scooter
customer_reviews.text: I love this scooter, I had foot surgery and I have carpal tunnel in both hands so crutches were out of the question. This scooter make my life so mobile. The basket is very useful for carrying everything that I need. The only flaw is it needs a softer seat. If using it for long periods of time it really is hard on your knee. I ordered the sheepskin cover and put extra foam under it to make it more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Debi Hoskins

customer_reviews.title: Great!  Top of the line Medical Knee Walker
customer_reviews.text: Scooter works perfectly for my handicap needs after major foot surgery. Very sturdy, easy to control. Fold down steering column to put into trunk and easy to set back up. Maneuvers well through my narrow door openings. Brake holds well and allows me to get on and off easily. Great construction. Basket very handy and convenient. Would recommend the Roscoe Brand over any thing else checked out prior to ordering. More reasonable to purchase than to rent for long usage. Thanks for the extra help in the Roscoe Facotry personnel in answering questions regarding scooter. You will not be disappointed..... g. young
customer_reviews.author: g. young

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: I returned this immediately. It is hard to turn. The pad that you rest your knee on is extremely uncomfortable right from the outset. Bad purchase. I rented one from a medical supply store that worked great and was comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Patty B

customer_reviews.title: Missing all parts that make it viable.  Not good for an emergency medical item.
customer_reviews.text: After looking forward to the independence of this for two days, it arrived without pins and handlebar knob making it useless. I'm Amazon faithful and cannot believe this. Now I have to rent one instead since there is not more time to wait for another failed product.
customer_reviews.author: Giggles

customer_reviews.title: mobility saver
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it. She had surgery on her foot this last week and uses the cart to help her get up and down into chairs etc.... She wouldn't be able to climb up onto crutches. It's cheaper to buy than to rent. however, without a blanket or towel to soften the top, she say's it hurts to ride on it after a few minutes. I have the cover on order.
customer_reviews.author: Splice

customer_reviews.title: am not good with crutches and walker limits distances and things I ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased knee scooter as broke my ankle, no weight bearing on leg; am not good with crutches and walker limits distances and things I can do. Is great for getting around, feel safe with wider base so no tipping; however wider base does mean wider turning space so can be a bit difficult at times. Not heavy so easy to get in and out of car. the only problem has been latch for fold down handle is a bit fussy so I generally leave the handle bar in upright position. am very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.author: Rose M. Blauser

customer_reviews.title: So glad I purchased this!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit hesitant about buying this knee walker at first, but now I can't imagine NOT having it. It is really well made and has been my best friend in my classroom during my healing time. I was wheelchair bound when I first received this and it took less than 15 minutes for me to assemble it even while I was in the wheelchair. I looked at many different brands of knee scooters and think that this is the absolute best deal- the price is excellent, as is the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette K. Rabideau

customer_reviews.title: Roscoe Scooter
customer_reviews.text: This scooter is worth every penny. It was easy to put together and has a low center of gravity. This is important as you don't want to fall off of it. the basket allows you to take stuff from one room to another. I only wish I had bought it when I had my first foot surgery. (This is number two.)
customer_reviews.author: Irene Moore

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: After having Achilles tendon surgery and being sentenced to a cast for 2 months this scooter is a Godsend compared to hobbling around on unstable crutches. Living alone, it has let me be independent instead of having to rely on friends and family to help with everything. Also, the basket is great and holds a lot and is a must for a scooter. Best money I've ever spent!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda L

customer_reviews.title: The scooter can be a crackup!
customer_reviews.text: The front wheel size is a little small and narrow which makes the scooter prone to turn into surface cracks and stop suddenly. Suggest keeping your weight as far behind the handle bar as possible to prevent tipping over when the front wheels suddenly turn sideways. The price is actually good as compared to what it costs to rent a scooter locally. I liked having the wire basket on the front. The scooter only weighs about 22 lbs. so it is easy to load into a vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Luther

customer_reviews.title: Roscoe Knee scooter really helps
customer_reviews.text: 5 Star in spite of the need to adjust parking brake after setup. Compared with using crutches for 9 weeks, this type of product is a real blessing. The basket may seem like a minor accessory until you use this - great to carry ice packs, cellphones, hand towel... Handle, however, is useless.
customer_reviews.author: z

customer_reviews.title: this has been a lifesaver and allowed my husband to ...
customer_reviews.text: this has been a lifesaver and allowed my husband to be mobile with a broken foot. husband noted it being unstable on uneven or bumpy ground. however, with caution he hasn't had any issues with it. it does have a wide turning radius that requires a lot of 3+ point turns.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend this knee roller
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this knee roller. Once you figure out how to drive, it's a breeze to get around. This is definitely a better alternative to crutches....and the price was great too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I made for after surgery
customer_reviews.text: Pros: very easy to use, but definitely buy it prior to any surgeries if possible so you can practice. Cons: Brake doesn't work that well, but I just used my foot for the brake. NO INSTRUCTIONS - had to google the product and watch a You Tube video to figure out how to put it together. NO INSTRUCTIONS on how to take it apart and I haven't been able to find a You Tube video to give instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: I found this to be the best way to get around and not have to put ...
customer_reviews.text: Tore my tendons and my ankle. Once the cast came off I was told that I would have to be off my ankle for six to eight weeks after surgery. I found this to be the best way to get around and not have to put any pressure on my foot. A lot easier than crutches.
customer_reviews.author: wend

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT! Well built, helps my husband get around and not worry about balance as with crutches!
customer_reviews.author: Pauline L Patterson

customer_reviews.title: It is as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: well built , can fold down , stable, larger wheels .... Anybody with a leg injury should be careful when navigating a turn, but this model seems to be more stable....only as "smart" as its driver though!
customer_reviews.author: J C

customer_reviews.title: A bit clumsy but does the job
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad unit, the company was slow in shipping and didn't update the process to track online. The unit itself doesn't have the best turn radius and the wheels can't handle small bumps or elevation changes without a noticeable stop. The brake cable is easy to catch on things too like drawer handles etc.me the knee pads are really firm and need to be softened up.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It was very sturdy and got my mother around quite well. The only con I saw was the scooter ' s inability to make wide/full turns. Otherwise it served its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Lisacakes

customer_reviews.title: OVERRATED
customer_reviews.text: We were very disappointed. The wheels and handle bars are not aligned properly for steering straight. Not sure why this is so highly priced, pretty poor quality control. We hope we can fix it by adjusting the base, but if not, will be sending back. Looks cute and does the job, but overrated.
customer_reviews.author: singingpalmtree

customer_reviews.title: I love this scooter
customer_reviews.text: I love this scooter. I cannot imagine being without it for 2 months. It literally saved me. The basket was wonderful to have. It is so much better than a wheel chair to get around the house although I didn't take it outside because you have to be very careful on rough surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Much better to purchase rather than renting one
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for almost 10 weeks now and it is still smooth. Basket is a necessity. Much better to purchase rather than renting one? Rental is approximately $150 month. For long term use, save money and just buy one.
customer_reviews.author: Lebby

customer_reviews.title: Not a good scooter, the brakes didn't stay adjusted when adjusted ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a good scooter, the brakes didn't stay adjusted when adjusted every week and the back tire kept falling off would not recommend this scooter to anyone please stay away from it it is a safety hazard
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kalt

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Great scooter. great alternative to crutches. ive used mine for over three months and love it. great quality. i weigh 350lbs and it does great. just go slow on it. you can tip over if you turn too sharp and quickly. one of the best things ive ever bought. highly recomend. easy to load. love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... to not need this anymore as it was really fun to zip around the house after my foot surgery
customer_reviews.text: I'm almost sorry to not need this anymore as it was really fun to zip around the house after my foot surgery. I got very adept at making corners and backing up. The brakes were easy to use for even my arthritic hands. This is so much better than crutches. I smiled every time I used it.
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!,
customer_reviews.text: This thing SAVED me so much headache when I had my cast. It was so much easier than my crutches that I ended up hauling the scooter up and down the stairs with me. It was easy to collapse. The only bummer is that it developed some squeaks a couple of weeks in.
customer_reviews.author: Becky T

customer_reviews.title: Great value, very practical!
customer_reviews.text: We rented this same model after I had Achilles tendon surgery. We could have practically paid for it had we purchased the scooter on Amazon rather than rented it. We bought this scooter after my husband broke his leg. It's been a lifesaver! He used it at work as an elementary school teacher and on our week-long visit to Disneyland at Christmas. Hopefully, we won't need it again for a long while, but we'll be prepared now. We also intend to lend it out to family members if needed.
customer_reviews.author: alcas

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, very handy but a bit hard to maneuver such as a turn. Hard on the knee you better get a soft foam padding. You cannot throw away your crutches, you need those for shorter distances. Overall glad we got this, for a broken ankle bone.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor No

customer_reviews.title: However awesome when non weight bearing
customer_reviews.text: Break wire often catches on things. Seat could be a little softer​ on the hnee. However awesome when non weight bearing. I would never have been able to leave the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great scooter. Very good price
customer_reviews.text: I was not able to put weight on my ankle for 3 months and this scooter turned out to be a great alternative to crutches. It is steerable and very sturdy. Get a pad cover to go with it. After a couple weeks, my knee was killing me. The pad made it much more comfortable. See the "Essential Medical Supply Knee Walker Pad Cover" on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: S. Person

customer_reviews.title: The scooter gives you freedom
customer_reviews.text: My son broke his heel bone into 9 pieces and can't put weight on it for 2 more months so the scooter has been a life saver he can get around the house and has returned to work. It is very sturdy and easy to maneuver. It is a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Paulette

customer_reviews.title: Great Scooter
customer_reviews.text: It was a hard working life saver when I broke a heel and had to be non-weight bearing for weeks. The basket is handy too. Easy to fold up, once you read the instructions carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Mote

customer_reviews.title: Lifeline during recovery
customer_reviews.text: Has been my lifeline to the outside world while recovering from a broken ankle. Would give 5 stars but had to replace original that had a defective locking mechanism. Amazon's quick replacement was much better and I am able to take it to work. Was a bit heavy to load in my car by myself at first, but figured out a way.
customer_reviews.author: J. Katz

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I broke my ankle in April, and had to be non weight-bearing for at least six weeks. I've broken my ankle before, and struggled with crutches and a wheelchair. With the wheelchair and crutches I stayed indoors and didn't venture far from my house. With this scooter, who knows where you'll find me. For those who've complained about the turning radius, all I can say is: physics! If it were any tighter, you'd end up on your fanny.
customer_reviews.author: AuntShell

customer_reviews.title: Knee-scooter
customer_reviews.text: The scooter has been great! Really helps---I broke my ankle. Much better than the walker first suggested. I was disappointed that it did not arrive in the 2 days that I paid extra postage for. It did arrive 2 days after leaving the facility---but not what I was paying for. Big Apple Supplies was GREAT and PROMPT with correspondence about the delivery time. VERY pleased with this company and will order again. Only problem with scooter is that a bolt on the wheel has come off---I will contact company re this.
customer_reviews.author: sdean

customer_reviews.title: Has been very helpful with my husband's mobility.. ...
customer_reviews.text: Has been very helpful with my husband's mobility...this model has been quite satisfactory...if we did it over again, he'd have prefered larger wheels for outdoor use...tricky and unstable with gravel and small stones on on sidewalks and pavement...
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Berrum

customer_reviews.title: Recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! At 61 with my first broken bone, right ankle, I knew crutches were not going to work. These knee cruisers weren't instantly available in my area to rent, and total rental costs with no prorating for partial months were prohibitive. So glad I thought to look to Amazon, and happy I was a member of Amazon Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite purchases. I have a non weight barring injury and will need to move around. It looks great and works well. I am very please with my scooter. It is practical and saved. me in rental cost from a medical pharmacy. I am happy!
customer_reviews.author: pgrant

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this product and it was VERY easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: This scooter was exactly what was needed for my broken ankle. When it was ordered, we expected it to arrive about 5 days later and it came in only 2 days! I am very happy with this product and it was VERY easy to assemble - it literally took 2 minutes to assemble. Would highly recommend it to anyone with an ankle injury. The handle folds down and was very easy to put into the car trunk.
customer_reviews.author: jan j

product_meta.title: Roscoe Knee Scooter with Basket - Knee Walker for Ankle or Foot Injuries - Height Adjustable Knee Crutch Medical Scooter, Burgundy
product_meta.description:
Roscoe knee scooters for foot injuries are an ideal solution for those seeking a safe, versatile crutch alternative. 

With an adjustable handle height between 31" - 41", a knee pad adjustment between 17.5" - 22", and a weight capacity of 350 lb. these knee walkers for adults will accommodate a variety of individuals. The offset post on the foot scooter's knee platform allows for easy, tool-free right-to-left adjustment depending on the location of the injury. 

The knee scooter is equipped with large 8" wheels, our knee roller can be used both indoors and outdoors. The easy folding mechanism that collapses using a thumb release lever and fits beneath the raised platform as well as the sizable scooter basket ensure you can take this equipment whenever you're on the go.

 Roscoe Medical scooters meet the needs of multiple indications including those looking for a medical scooter for foot surgery or those seeking a leg scooter for broken foot or other injuries associated with the foot, leg, or ankle. The padded knee platform provides excellent comfort for a user's knees and with padded handle bar grips, adjustable hand-brakes, our broken foot scooter is top-of-the-line in the durable medical equipment industry.

Limited lifetime warranty on frame, 90 days on all other parts.

Features and Benefits Of Our Knee Scooter: 

 * Avoid re-injury. Our knee scooters are premium quality, built with safety in mind, quality assurance tested by our best-in-class QA department
 * Keeps You More Saft. Navigate rough terrain with our knee scooters
 * Maximized Control. Our knee scooters are built with disc brakes, allowign for better control
 * Comfortable Ride. Our padded seat and handlebars maximized comfort while riding, alleviating discomfort
